00029 #define  NITF_MAX_EMESSAGE 1024
00030 #define  NITF_CTXT NITF_FILE, NITF_LINE, NITF_FUNC
00031 
00032 #ifdef WIN32
00033 #  define NITF_ERRNO GetLastError()
00034 #  define NITF_STRERROR(E) strerror(E)
00035 #else
00036 #  define  NITF_ERRNO errno
00037 #  define  NITF_STRERROR(E) strerror(E)
00038 #endif

00042 /*
00043  *
00044  *  An error level can be low, medium, high, or critical.
00045  *
00046  */
00047 enum
00048 {
00049     NITF_ERR_MEMORY = 1,
00050     NITF_ERR_OPENING_FILE,
00051     NITF_ERR_READING_FROM_FILE,
00052     NITF_ERR_SEEKING_IN_FILE,
00053     NITF_ERR_WRITING_TO_FILE,
00054     NITF_ERR_STAT_FILE,
00055     NITF_ERR_LOADING_DLL,
00056     NITF_ERR_UNLOADING_DLL,
00057     NITF_ERR_RETRIEVING_DLL_HOOK,
00058     NITF_ERR_UNINITIALIZED_DLL_READ,
00059     NITF_ERR_INVALID_PARAMETER,
00060     NITF_ERR_INVALID_OBJECT,
00061     NITF_ERR_INVALID_FILE,
00062     NITF_ERR_COMPRESSION,
00063     NITF_ERR_DECOMPRESSION,
00064     NITF_ERR_PARSING_FILE,
00065     NITF_ERR_INT_STACK_OVERFLOW,
00066     NITF_ERR_UNK
00067 };
00068 
00075 typedef struct _nitf_Error
00076 {
00077     char message[NITF_MAX_EMESSAGE + 1];
00078     char file[NITF_MAX_PATH + 1];
00079     int line;
00080     char func[NITF_MAX_PATH + 1];
00081     int level;
00082 }
00083 nitf_Error;
